revised_title: Amino-Acid Incorporation in Mammary Tissue: Physiology and Biochemistry of Lactation
tldr: The authors discuss the steps in amino-acid incorporation into mammary tissue, focusing on the physiology and biochemistry of lactation. They explore amino-acid activation, soluble ribonucleic acid (RNA), and intracellular particles as key factors in the process. The study provides insights into protein synthesis and the role of amino acids in lactation.
